summary: This document is an email chain from August 2019 discussing a tour of a prison facility, specifically referencing '10 South' and Special Administrative Measures (SAMs). The correspondence involves prison officials discussing inmate confinement conditions and the rarity of SAMs, which are imposed by the Attorney General typically in national security cases.

persons.name: Warden
persons.context: Mentioned as being impressive during a tour of the prison facility.

events.title: Prison Tour
events.description: A tour of a prison facility took place, during which the warden was described as impressive.

keyFacts: The email discusses Special Administrative Measures (SAMs), which are restrictive confinement conditions imposed by the Attorney General, typically in national security cases.
SAM inmates are housed in '10 South' and at the ADX (Administrative Maximum Facility).
The correspondence indicates that there are very few inmates subject to SAMs due to the severe limitations on communication.
The document is dated August 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody, suggesting possible context related to his case or similar high-profile inmates.
